title: How many sentences are in a 1500-word essay? - Quora

response.answer_text: Randomly select three sentences from the essay. Count how many words they have and divide them by three. That will give you the average sentence length in words. Divide that number into 1500, and you’ll have a good approximation of how many sentences are in that particular essay. If instead you are trying to figure out how many sentences you will use in an essay you are about to write, and you are aiming for 1500 words, take one of your older essays and do the formula above to figure out your average sentence length. Then extrapolate as above.

The fact of the matter is there is no complete response to this inquiry. The quantity of words it will take to fill a page will rely upon various variables including the sort of text style utilized, the text dimension, separating components, the edges utilized on the paper, the section length, and so forth. For instance, if the task says the written work ought to be in 10-point textual style, it will take a more noteworthy number of words to fill a page than if the task requires a 12-point textual style. For the individuals who require a general dependable guideline, a normal page which has 1-inch edges and is written in 12 point text style with standard separating components will be around 500 words when composed single divided. For assignments that require twofold separating, it would take roughly 250 words to fill the page. For a task that expects you to compose four pages, you can make the estimation that you'll have to compose around 2000 words for a solitary separated paper, or 1000 words if the task is twofold dispersed. Once more, the kind of text style utilized can make the most of the word higher or lower, however it's a decent dependable guideline for the individuals who are essentially searching for a general estimation.
